data.title: Christopher Cross Official Website
data.meta_description: Christopher Cross was by far the biggest new star of 1980, virtually defining adult contemporary radio with a series of smoothly sophisticated ballads including the #1 hit, “Sailing.”Christopher Cross’ 1980 self-titled debut album with the lead single “Ride Like the Wind” rocketed to the #2 spot.
data.text:
Tabitha Fair - vocals

Tabitha Fair has performed and toured with some of the music industry’s finest artists. She has shared the stage with Sting, Beyonce, Bruno Mars, Lady Gaga, U2, Celine Dion, Faith Hill, Wynonna Judd, Lee Ann Womack, Rascal Flatts, Rita Wilson, Amy Grant, Third Day, Sam Moore, James Taylor, Fall Out Boy, Bette Midler, Lenny Kravitz, Bruce Springsteen, John Legend, The Roots, Jennifer Hudson, Michael McDonald, Elton John, Mary J Blige, Snoop Dog, and many more! Shortly after touring with Amy Grant at the beginning of her career, Tabitha co-founded Avalon, the highest selling Contemporary Christian group of all time. As a Vocal Coach Tabitha specializes in performance training, vocal artistry, and artist development. Her wide ranging experience in the music industry is unrivaled as a performer, vocalist, and writer, and Tabitha enjoys passing her years of wisdom on to her clients.

Recipient of the Songwriters Hall of Fame’s Abe Ohlman Award (2001)

Performed at the second inaugurations of President Bill Clinton (1997) and President Barack Obama (2012)

Performed at the Hope for Haiti Now Benefit Concert (2010)

Performed at the Kennedy Center Honors for the past 12 years

Performed on the 4th of July PBS Concert (2011)

Performed with Lady Gaga at the Grammy Awards (2018)

Background vocalist for Sting and Trudie Stylers Rainforest Benefit for the last 15 years

Performed on the Fourth of July celebration on CBS (numerous times)

Nominated for a Grammy with Desmond Child live album (2021)

Worship team vocal producer at Cornerstone Church Nashville

Co-writer and singer with Carol King for song If We Get Through This for the film ‘Sum of All Fears’

Performed for Sonic Adventure 2 with Fumie Kumatani​

Website

Lisbet Guldbaek - vocals

Lisbet was born in Denmark. She started a very early musical career at eleven years old with the lead role in the world-known musical « Annie », followed with two other Danish musicals.

She arrived in Paris in the early 90's and performed in various different clubs. She worked with Michel Legrand and recorded lead vocals in numerous cartoons "Il était une fois l'Amérique", "Les découvreurs" and the lead vocals in Daniel Steel's film "The Ring" .

Lisbet had the lead role in several musicals in Paris, "Les Années Twist », " La Fièvre des Années 80 ». The part of Claudia in Broadway Musical « Nine », the part of Dionne in « hair », the part of Vi Moore in « Footloose ». She played Bithia, the Egyptian Princess, in the french big success "Les Dix Commandements » More than 1,6 million albums were sold and 1,8 million people saw the musical.

Lisbet released two albums « Raindrops » on iTunes and « The beautiful » on iTunes & Spotify.

She’s been backing vocalist on tour, on TV Shows and in studio for several French artists such as Johnny Hallyday, Michel Sardou, Gerard Darmon, Native, Michel Fugain and also with international artists like Tom Jones & Seal (on live TV) and on tour with Tina Arena and Christopher Cross.

Wes Little - drums

Wes Little is one of Nashville’s most adaptable and multi-faceted drummers, as well as a top flight arranger, producer and songwriter. Formally trained in performance and composition at the Manhattan School of Music and shaped by years of studio and stage work with major acts from across the spectrum, Little brings complete musicality to every kind of gig. Currently a first call session drummer in Nashville, Little has also performed or recorded with Chuck D, Stevie Wonder, Sting, Steven Tyler of Aerosmith, John Legend, Melissa Etheridge, Robben Ford, Michael and Randy Brecker, Tim McGraw and Faith Hill. He works in Nashville, where he lives and records daily in the studio.

Little has recorded or toured with:

Robben Ford • Christopher Cross • Tim McGraw • Faith Hill • Trey Anastasio • Little River Band • Larry Carlton • Sting • Stevie Wonder • Alicia Keys • Beyonce • Joe Perry • Steven Tyler • John Legend • Jamie Fox • Melissa Etheridge • Jermaine Jackson • Mariah Carey • Public Enemy • Shakira • Busta Rhymes • Emmylou Harris • Mary J. Blige Anita Baker • Paul Shaffer • Joe Dee Messina • Joe Nichols • Dierks Bentley • Jimmy Wayne • Billy Dean • Chuck D. and Fine Arts Militia • Lorrie Morgan • Pam Tillis • Ashley Cleveland • Terri Clark • Chuck D. and Confrontation Camp • Bootsy Collins • MC Lyte • KRS-One • Vernon Reid • Delbert McClinton • Big Daddy Kane • Diana Degarmo • The Pointer Sisters • Dennis Edwards (The Temptations) • Melba Moore • Randy Brecker • Michael Brecker • Wynonna Judd • Pam Tillis • Lorrie Morgan • Luke Combs • Warren Haynes • Sonny Landreth • Robin Meade • Keith Burns • Heidi Newfeld • Bill Evans (Sax) • Haley Reinhart • Adam Wakefield • Charles Esteen • Little Big Town • Gavin DeGraw • John Schneider • Jay DeMarcus • Eric Johnson • Larry Carlton • Deena Carter • Trey Anastasio • Danny Gokey • Natalie Grant • Matt Wertz • Jeffrey Steele • Candi Carpenter • T. Graham Brown • Dailey and Vincent • Scotty McCreery • Brantley Gilbert • Lee Brice • Thomas Rhett • Payton Smith • Paul Schaffer • Dennis Edwards • Lee Roy Parnell • Trick Pony • Trent Wilmon • Lisa Guerrero • T. Graham Brown • Gary Nicholson and his own venture - The Big Greasy.

On another note, Little also did some Broadway Shows in NYC. “I have made whip crack sounds for John Lithgow in "Dirty Rotten Scoundrels,” says Little. “I have played quite possibly the largest set up in the world of drums and percussion in the show BKLYN. I acted the part of a drummer that couldn't speak in the show "Once Around the Sun.” I also played in a big bang on stage for 3 months in a show of “Rat Pack, Live at the Sands."

Selected Discography

Ready, Set, Summer - Payton Smith (2020)

Purple House - Robben Ford (2018)

Made to Last - Robben Ford (2018)

The Rest of Out Life - Tim McGraw, Faith Hill (2107)

We’re All Somebody from Somewhere - Steven Tyler (2016)

Pony Up - Trick Pony (2016)

Into the Sun - Robben Ford (2015)

A Day In Nashville - Robben Ford (2014)

Cuts Like a Diamond - Little River Band (2013)

www.weslittle.com
